service:
Use the Amazon OpenSearch Serverless API to create, configure, and manage OpenSearch Serverless collections and security policies.

OpenSearch Serverless is an on-demand, pre-provisioned serverless configuration for Amazon OpenSearch Service. OpenSearch Serverless removes the operational complexities of provisioning, configuring, and tuning your OpenSearch clusters. It enables you to easily search and analyze petabytes of data without having to worry about the underlying infrastructure and data management.

To learn more about OpenSearch Serverless, see What is Amazon OpenSearch Serverless?

operations.BatchGetCollection: Returns attributes for one or more collections, including the collection endpoint and the OpenSearch Dashboards endpoint. For more information, see Creating and managing Amazon OpenSearch Serverless collections.
operations.BatchGetVpcEndpoint: Returns attributes for one or more VPC endpoints associated with the current account. For more information, see Access Amazon OpenSearch Serverless using an interface endpoint.
operations.CreateAccessPolicy: Creates a data access policy for OpenSearch Serverless. Access policies limit access to collections and the resources within them, and allow a user to access that data irrespective of the access mechanism or network source. For more information, see Data access control for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless.
operations.CreateCollection: Creates a new OpenSearch Serverless collection. For more information, see Creating and managing Amazon OpenSearch Serverless collections.
operations.CreateSecurityConfig: Specifies a security configuration for OpenSearch Serverless. For more information, see SAML authentication for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless.
operations.CreateSecurityPolicy: Creates a security policy to be used by one or more OpenSearch Serverless collections. Security policies provide access to a collection and its OpenSearch Dashboards endpoint from public networks or specific VPC endpoints. They also allow you to secure a collection with a KMS encryption key. For more information, see Network access for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless and Encryption at rest for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless.
operations.CreateVpcEndpoint: Creates an OpenSearch Serverless-managed interface VPC endpoint. For more information, see Access Amazon OpenSearch Serverless using an interface endpoint.
operations.DeleteAccessPolicy: Deletes an OpenSearch Serverless access policy. For more information, see Data access control for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless.
operations.DeleteCollection: Deletes an OpenSearch Serverless collection. For more information, see Creating and managing Amazon OpenSearch Serverless collections.
operations.DeleteSecurityConfig: Deletes a security configuration for OpenSearch Serverless. For more information, see SAML authentication for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless.
operations.DeleteVpcEndpoint: Deletes an OpenSearch Serverless-managed interface endpoint. For more information, see Access Amazon OpenSearch Serverless using an interface endpoint.
operations.GetAccessPolicy: Returns an OpenSearch Serverless access policy. For more information, see Data access control for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless.
operations.GetAccountSettings: Returns account-level settings related to OpenSearch Serverless.
operations.GetPoliciesStats: Returns statistical information about your OpenSearch Serverless access policies, security configurations, and security policies.
operations.GetSecurityConfig: Returns information about an OpenSearch Serverless security configuration. For more information, see SAML authentication for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless.
operations.GetSecurityPolicy: Returns information about a configured OpenSearch Serverless security policy. For more information, see Network access for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless and Encryption at rest for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless.
operations.ListAccessPolicies: Returns information about a list of OpenSearch Serverless access policies.
operations.ListCollections:
Lists all OpenSearch Serverless collections. For more information, see Creating and managing Amazon OpenSearch Serverless collections.

Make sure to include an empty request body {} if you don't include any collection filters in the request.
operations.ListSecurityConfigs: Returns information about configured OpenSearch Serverless security configurations. For more information, see SAML authentication for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless.
operations.ListSecurityPolicies: Returns information about configured OpenSearch Serverless security policies.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Returns the tags for an OpenSearch Serverless resource. For more information, see Tagging Amazon OpenSearch Serverless collections.
operations.ListVpcEndpoints: Returns the OpenSearch Serverless-managed interface VPC endpoints associated with the current account. For more information, see Access Amazon OpenSearch Serverless using an interface endpoint.
operations.TagResource: Associates tags with an OpenSearch Serverless resource. For more information, see Tagging Amazon OpenSearch Serverless collections.
operations.UntagResource: Removes a tag or set of tags from an OpenSearch Serverless resource. For more information, see Tagging Amazon OpenSearch Serverless collections.
operations.UpdateAccessPolicy: Updates an OpenSearch Serverless access policy. For more information, see Data access control for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless.
operations.UpdateAccountSettings: Update the OpenSearch Serverless settings for the current Amazon Web Services account. For more information, see Autoscaling.
operations.UpdateSecurityConfig: Updates a security configuration for OpenSearch Serverless. For more information, see SAML authentication for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless.
operations.UpdateSecurityPolicy: Updates an OpenSearch Serverless security policy. For more information, see Network access for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless and Encryption at rest for Amazon OpenSearch Serverless.
operations.UpdateVpcEndpoint: Updates an OpenSearch Serverless-managed interface endpoint. For more information, see Access Amazon OpenSearch Serverless using an interface endpoint.

AccessPolicyDetail.base: Details about an OpenSearch Serverless access policy.

AccessPolicyStats.base: Statistics for an OpenSearch Serverless access policy.

refs.GetPoliciesStatsResponse$AccessPolicySta: Information about the data access policies in your account.

AccessPolicySummary.base: A summary of the data access policy.

refs.AccessPolicySummary$type: The type of access policy. Currently the only available type is data.
refs.GetAccessPolicyRequest$type: Tye type of policy. Currently the only supported value is data.

AccountSettingsDetail.base: OpenSearch Serverless-related information for the current account.

refs.GetAccountSettingsResponse$accountSettin: OpenSearch Serverless-related details for the current account.
refs.UpdateAccountSettingsResponse$accountSet: OpenSearch Serverless-related settings for the current Amazon Web Services account.

refs.ListTagsForResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource. The resource must be active (not in the DELETING state), and must be owned by the account ID included in the request.
refs.TagResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource. The resource must be active (not in the DELETING state), and must be owned by the account ID included in the request.
refs.UntagResourceRequest$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to remove tags from. The resource must be active (not in the DELETING state), and must be owned by the account ID included in the request.

CapacityLimits.base: The maximum capacity limits for all OpenSearch Serverless collections, in OpenSearch Compute Units (OCUs). These limits are used to scale your collections based on the current workload. For more information, see Autoscaling.

refs.CreateAccessPolicyRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.CreateCollectionRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.CreateSecurityConfigRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.CreateSecurityPolicyRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.CreateVpcEndpointRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.DeleteAccessPolicyRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.DeleteCollectionRequest$clientToken: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.DeleteSecurityConfigRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.DeleteSecurityPolicyRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.DeleteVpcEndpointRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.UpdateAccessPolicyRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.UpdateCollectionRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.UpdateSecurityConfigRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.UpdateSecurityPolicyRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.
refs.UpdateVpcEndpointRequest$clientToken: Unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.

CollectionDetail.base: Details about each OpenSearch Serverless collection, including the collection endpoint and the OpenSearch Dashboards endpoint.

CollectionErrorDetail.base: Error information for an OpenSearch Serverless request.

CollectionFilters.base: List of filter keys that you can use for LIST, UPDATE, and DELETE requests to OpenSearch Serverless collections.

refs.ListCollectionsRequest$collectionFilters: List of filter names and values that you can use for requests.

refs.CollectionErrorDetail$id: If the request contains collection IDs, the response includes the IDs provided in the request.
refs.DeleteCollectionRequest$id: The unique identifier of the collection. For example, 1iu5usc406kd. The ID is part of the collection endpoint. You can also retrieve it using the ListCollections API.

refs.BatchGetCollectionRequest$ids: A list of collection IDs. You can't provide names and IDs in the same request. The ID is part of the collection endpoint. You can also retrieve it using the ListCollections API.

refs.CollectionErrorDetail$name: If the request contains collection names, the response includes the names provided in the request.

refs.BatchGetCollectionRequest$names: A list of collection names. You can't provide names and IDs in the same request.

ConflictException.base: When creating a collection, thrown when a collection with the same name already exists or is being created. When deleting a collection, thrown when the collection is not in the ACTIVE or FAILED state.

CreateCollectionDetail.base: Details about the created OpenSearch Serverless collection.

CreateVpcEndpointDetail.base: Creation details for an OpenSearch Serverless-managed interface endpoint. For more information, see Access Amazon OpenSearch Serverless using an interface endpoint.

refs.CreateVpcEndpointResponse$createVpcEndpo: Details about the created interface VPC endpoint.

DeleteCollectionDetail.base: Details about a deleted OpenSearch Serverless collection.

DeleteVpcEndpointDetail.base: Deletion details for an OpenSearch Serverless-managed interface endpoint.

refs.AccessPolicyDetail$policy: The JSON policy document without any whitespaces.
refs.SecurityPolicyDetail$policy: The JSON policy document without any whitespaces.

InternalServerException.base: Thrown when an error internal to the service occurs while processing a request.

refs.ListAccessPoliciesRequest$maxResults: An optional parameter that specifies the maximum number of results to return. You can use nextToken to get the next page of results. The default is 20.

refs.ListAccessPoliciesRequest$resource: Resource filters (can be collection or indexes) that policies can apply to.

refs.ListCollectionsRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 20. You can use nextToken to get the next page of results.

refs.ListSecurityConfigsRequest$maxResults: An optional parameter that specifies the maximum number of results to return. You can use nextToken to get the next page of results. The default is 20.

refs.ListSecurityPoliciesRequest$maxResults: An optional parameter that specifies the maximum number of results to return. You can use nextToken to get the next page of results. The default is 20.

refs.ListSecurityPoliciesRequest$resource: Resource filters (can be collection or indexes) that policies can apply to.

refs.ListVpcEndpointsRequest$maxResults: An optional parameter that specifies the maximum number of results to return. You can use nextToken to get the next page of results. The default is 20.

refs.AccessPolicyDetail$lastModifiedDate: The timestamp of when the policy was last modified.
refs.AccessPolicyStats$DataPolicyCount: The number of data access policies in the current account.
refs.AccessPolicySummary$createdDate: The Epoch time when the access policy was created.
refs.AccessPolicySummary$lastModifiedDate: The date and time when the collection was last modified.
refs.CollectionDetail$createdDate: The Epoch time when the collection was created.
refs.CollectionDetail$lastModifiedDate: The date and time when the collection was last modified.
refs.CreateCollectionDetail$createdDate: The Epoch time when the collection was created.
refs.CreateCollectionDetail$lastModifiedDate: The date and time when the collection was last modified.
refs.GetPoliciesStatsResponse$TotalPolicyCoun: The total number of OpenSearch Serverless security policies and configurations in your account.
refs.SecurityConfigDetail$lastModifiedDate: The timestamp of when the configuration was last modified.
refs.SecurityConfigStats$SamlConfigCount: The number of security configurations in the current account.
refs.SecurityConfigSummary$createdDate: The Epoch time when the security configuration was created.
refs.SecurityConfigSummary$lastModifiedDate: The timestamp of when the configuration was last modified.
refs.SecurityPolicyDetail$lastModifiedDate: The timestamp of when the policy was last modified.
refs.SecurityPolicyStats$EncryptionPolicyCoun: The number of encryption policies in the current account.
refs.SecurityPolicyStats$NetworkPolicyCount: The number of network policies in the current account.
refs.SecurityPolicySummary$lastModifiedDate: The timestamp of when the policy was last modified.
refs.UpdateCollectionDetail$createdDate: The date and time when the collection was created.
refs.UpdateCollectionDetail$lastModifiedDate: The date and time when the collection was last modified.
refs.UpdateVpcEndpointDetail$lastModifiedDate: The timestamp of when the endpoint was last modified.

refs.CreateAccessPolicyRequest$description: A description of the policy. Typically used to store information about the permissions defined in the policy.
refs.CreateSecurityPolicyRequest$description: A description of the policy. Typically used to store information about the permissions defined in the policy.
refs.UpdateAccessPolicyRequest$description: A description of the policy. Typically used to store information about the permissions defined in the policy.
refs.UpdateSecurityPolicyRequest$description: A description of the policy. Typically used to store information about the permissions defined in the policy.

refs.CreateAccessPolicyRequest$policy: The JSON policy document to use as the content for the policy.
refs.CreateSecurityPolicyRequest$policy: The JSON policy document to use as the content for the new policy.
refs.UpdateAccessPolicyRequest$policy: The JSON policy document to use as the content for the policy.
refs.UpdateSecurityPolicyRequest$policy: The JSON policy document to use as the content for the new policy.

refs.DeleteAccessPolicyRequest$name: The name of the policy to delete.
refs.DeleteSecurityPolicyRequest$name: The name of the policy to delete.

refs.UpdateAccessPolicyRequest$policyVersion: The version of the policy being updated.
refs.UpdateSecurityConfigRequest$configVersio: The version of the security configuration to be updated. You can find the most recent version of a security configuration using the GetSecurityPolicy command.
refs.UpdateSecurityPolicyRequest$policyVersio: The version of the policy being updated.

ResourceNotFoundException.base: Thrown when accessing or deleting a resource that does not exist.

SamlConfigOptions.base: Describes SAML options for an OpenSearch Serverless security configuration in the form of a key-value map.

refs.CreateSecurityConfigRequest$samlOptions: Describes SAML options in in the form of a key-value map.
refs.SecurityConfigDetail$samlOptions: SAML options for the security configuration in the form of a key-value map.
refs.UpdateSecurityConfigRequest$samlOptions: SAML options in in the form of a key-value map.

refs.SamlConfigOptions$sessionTimeout: The session timeout, in minutes. Minimum is 15 minutes and maximum is 1440 minutes (24 hours or 1 day). Default is 60 minutes.

SecurityConfigDetail.base: Details about a security configuration for OpenSearch Serverless.

refs.DeleteSecurityConfigRequest$id: The security configuration identifier. For SAML the ID will be saml/<accountId>/<idpProviderName>. For example, saml/123456789123/OKTADev.
refs.GetSecurityConfigRequest$id: The unique identifier of the security configuration.
refs.SecurityConfigDetail$id: The unique identifier of the security configuration.
refs.SecurityConfigSummary$id: The unique identifier of the security configuration.
refs.UpdateSecurityConfigRequest$id: The security configuration identifier. For SAML the ID will be saml/<accountId>/<idpProviderName>. For example, saml/123456789123/OKTADev.

SecurityConfigStats.base: Statistics for an OpenSearch Serverless security configuration.

refs.GetPoliciesStatsResponse$SecurityConfigS: Information about the security configurations in your account.

refs.ListSecurityConfigsResponse$securityConf: Details about the security configurations in your account.

SecurityConfigSummary.base: A summary of a security configuration for OpenSearch Serverless.

refs.CreateVpcEndpointRequest$securityGroupId: The unique identifiers of the security groups that define the ports, protocols, and sources for inbound traffic that you are authorizing into your endpoint.
refs.UpdateVpcEndpointDetail$securityGroupIds: The unique identifiers of the security groups that define the ports, protocols, and sources for inbound traffic that you are authorizing into your endpoint.
refs.UpdateVpcEndpointRequest$addSecurityGrou: The unique identifiers of the security groups to add to the endpoint. Security groups define the ports, protocols, and sources for inbound traffic that you are authorizing into your endpoint.
refs.UpdateVpcEndpointRequest$removeSecurityG: The unique identifiers of the security groups to remove from the endpoint.
refs.VpcEndpointDetail$securityGroupIds: The unique identifiers of the security groups that define the ports, protocols, and sources for inbound traffic that you are authorizing into your endpoint.

SecurityPolicyDetail.base: Details about an OpenSearch Serverless security policy.

SecurityPolicyStats.base: Statistics for an OpenSearch Serverless security policy.

refs.GetPoliciesStatsResponse$SecurityPolicyS: Information about the security policies in your account.

refs.ListSecurityPoliciesResponse$securityPol: Details about the security policies in your account.

SecurityPolicySummary.base: A summary of a security policy for OpenSearch Serverless.

refs.CollectionDetail$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the collection.
refs.CollectionDetail$collectionEndpoint: Collection-specific endpoint used to submit index, search, and data upload requests to an OpenSearch Serverless collection.
refs.CollectionDetail$dashboardEndpoint: Collection-specific endpoint used to access OpenSearch Dashboards.
refs.CollectionDetail$kmsKeyArn: The ARN of the Amazon Web Services KMS key used to encrypt the collection.
refs.CollectionErrorDetail$errorCode: The error code for the request. For example, NOT_FOUND.
refs.CollectionErrorDetail$errorMessage: A description of the error. For example, The specified Collection is not found.
refs.CollectionSummary$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the collection.
refs.CreateCollectionDetail$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the collection.
refs.CreateCollectionDetail$kmsKeyArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key with which to encrypt the collection.
refs.ListAccessPoliciesRequest$nextToken: If your initial ListAccessPolicies operation returns a nextToken, you can include the returned nextToken in subsequent ListAccessPolicies operations, which returns results in the next page.
refs.ListAccessPoliciesResponse$nextToken: When nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.
refs.ListCollectionsRequest$nextToken: If your initial ListCollections operation returns a nextToken, you can include the returned nextToken in subsequent ListCollections operations, which returns results in the next page.
refs.ListCollectionsResponse$nextToken: When nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.
refs.ListSecurityConfigsRequest$nextToken: If your initial ListSecurityConfigs operation returns a nextToken, you can include the returned nextToken in subsequent ListSecurityConfigs operations, which returns results in the next page.
refs.ListSecurityConfigsResponse$nextToken: When nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.
refs.ListSecurityPoliciesRequest$nextToken: If your initial ListSecurityPolicies operation returns a nextToken, you can include the returned nextToken in subsequent ListSecurityPolicies operations, which returns results in the next page.
refs.ListSecurityPoliciesResponse$nextToken: When nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.
refs.ListVpcEndpointsRequest$nextToken: If your initial ListVpcEndpoints operation returns a nextToken, you can include the returned nextToken in subsequent ListVpcEndpoints operations, which returns results in the next page.
refs.ListVpcEndpointsResponse$nextToken: When nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.
refs.UpdateCollectionDetail$arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the collection.
refs.VpcEndpointErrorDetail$errorCode: The error code for the failed request.
refs.VpcEndpointErrorDetail$errorMessage: An error message describing the reason for the failure.

refs.CreateVpcEndpointRequest$subnetIds: The ID of one or more subnets from which you'll access OpenSearch Serverless.
refs.UpdateVpcEndpointDetail$subnetIds: The ID of the subnets from which you access OpenSearch Serverless.
refs.UpdateVpcEndpointRequest$addSubnetIds: The ID of one or more subnets to add to the endpoint.
refs.UpdateVpcEndpointRequest$removeSubnetIds: The unique identifiers of the subnets to remove from the endpoint.
refs.VpcEndpointDetail$subnetIds: The ID of the subnets from which you access OpenSearch Serverless.

Tag.base: A map of key-value pairs associated to an OpenSearch Serverless resource.

refs.Tag$key: The key to use in the tag.

refs.UntagResourceRequest$tagKeys: The tag or set of tags to remove from the resource. All tag keys in the request must be unique.

refs.CreateCollectionRequest$tags: An arbitrary set of tags (keyâ€“value pairs) to associate with the OpenSearch Serverless collection.
refs.TagResourceRequest$tags: A list of tags (key-value pairs) to add to the resource. All tag keys in the request must be unique.

UpdateCollectionDetail.base: Details about an updated OpenSearch Serverless collection.

UpdateVpcEndpointDetail.base: Update details for an OpenSearch Serverless-managed interface endpoint.

ValidationException.base: Thrown when the HTTP request contains invalid input or is missing required input.

VpcEndpointDetail.base: Details about an OpenSearch Serverless-managed interface endpoint.

refs.ListVpcEndpointsRequest$vpcEndpointFilte: Filter the results according to the current status of the VPC endpoint. Possible statuses are CREATING, DELETING, UPDATING, ACTIVE, and FAILED.

refs.UpdateVpcEndpointRequest$id: The unique identifier of the interface endpoint to update.
refs.VpcEndpointErrorDetail$id: The unique identifier of the VPC endpoint.

refs.CreateVpcEndpointDetail$status: The current status in the endpoint creation process.
refs.DeleteVpcEndpointDetail$status: The current status of the endpoint deletion process.
refs.UpdateVpcEndpointDetail$status: The current status of the endpoint update process.

refs.ListVpcEndpointsResponse$vpcEndpointSumm: Details about each VPC endpoint, including the name and current status.

refs.CreateVpcEndpointRequest$vpcId: The ID of the VPC from which you'll access OpenSearch Serverless.
refs.VpcEndpointDetail$vpcId: The ID of the VPC from which you access OpenSearch Serverless

refs.SamlConfigOptions$groupAttribute: The group attribute for this SAML integration.

refs.SamlConfigOptions$metadata: The XML IdP metadata file generated from your identity provider.

refs.SamlConfigOptions$userAttribute: A user attribute for this SAML integration.
